description: Before everyone takes out trash, there are 100 units of trash in the house.
Luke wanted to take out 100 units of trash, and took out 80 units.

The group agreed to implement a fair and balanced trash collection system, aiming for 20 units per person monthly, with tracking and adjustments as needed, after Luke's significant contribution this month inspired a discussion about workload equity.
conversation: Mayor

Ladies and gentlemen, let me give you the monthly trash report. John caught 10 units of trash. Kate caught 10 units of trash. Jack caught 0 units of trash. Emma caught 0 units of trash. Luke caught 80 units of trash.
John

Wow, Luke, you really went all out this month! Thanks for taking care of most of it. I guess Jack and Emma are saving their energy for next time, huh? Let's try to keep it balanced moving forward so no one gets stuck with too much work.
Kate

Thanks, Luke, for stepping up this month! I appreciate the effort. John, you're right—balancing the workload would be ideal. Maybe we can set a rotation or agree on a fair amount each month so no one feels overwhelmed. What do you all think?
Jack

Thanks, Luke, for handling so much this month—it really helps! I agree with John and Kate that we should aim for a more balanced approach moving forward. Maybe we can set a rotation or agree on a fixed amount each month, like 20 units per person? That way, no one ends up with too much or too little. What do you all think?
Emma

Thanks, Luke, for taking on so much this month—it really made a difference! I agree with everyone about balancing the workload. A rotation or fixed amount per person sounds fair. Maybe we could even track it monthly to ensure everyone contributes equally over time. What if we aim for 20 units per person, as Jack suggested, and adjust if needed? That way, we can all share the responsibility without anyone feeling overwhelmed.
Luke

Thanks, everyone, for the kind words! I’m glad I could help out this month, but I agree that a more balanced approach would be better in the long run. Jack’s suggestion of 20 units per person sounds fair, and I like Emma’s idea of tracking contributions monthly to keep things even. Let’s try that for the next few months and see how it works. If anyone has a particularly busy month, we can always adjust and support each other. Sound good?
John

That sounds like a solid plan, everyone! I’m on board with the 20 units per person and tracking contributions monthly. It’s great that we’re all committed to keeping things fair and balanced. Let’s check in next month to see how it’s working and make adjustments if needed. Thanks again, Luke, for setting such a great example this month—it’s really motivating to see everyone stepping up!
